channel.title: Comments on: Cleaning Out Git Remotes The Easy Way

item.title: By: Derick Bailey
item.dc:creator: Derick Bailey
item.description: i knew there was a better way than what i was doing! :)
item.content:encoded: i knew there was a better way than what i was doing! :)

item.title: By: Anonymous
item.dc:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
git remote | grep -v 'origin' | while read REMOTE; do > git remote rm $REMOTE > done
This would be better though:
git remote | grep -v 'origin' | xargs -L1 git remote rm $*
item.content:encoded:
git remote | grep -v ‘origin’ | while read REMOTE; do
> git remote rm $REMOTE
> done

This would be better though:

git remote | grep -v ‘origin’ | xargs -L1 git remote rm $*

item.title: By: Derick Bailey
item.dc:creator: Derick Bailey
item.description: doh! thanks for letting me know about that. i'll see if we can get that fixed.
item.content:encoded: doh! thanks for letting me know about that. i’ll see if we can get that fixed.

item.title: By: Mark IJbema
item.dc:creator: Mark IJbema
item.description: Your comment-rss link is broken btw..

item.title: By: Mark IJbema
item.dc:creator: Mark IJbema
item.description:
Though you can actually do this with bash-fu, most of the times I do this by using perl oneliners, so for instance:
git remote | perl -pe 'if(!/origin/){s/.*/rm $&/}else{$_=""}'
And if you like like what you see, add | sh
Personally I think Perl is just a bit more readable/writeable, without becoming to verbose (i dislike ruby for this, since it's not that well suited for writing oneliners imho)
item.content:encoded:
Though you can actually do this with bash-fu, most of the times I do this by using perl oneliners, so for instance:

git remote | perl -pe ‘if(!/origin/){s/.*/rm $&/}else{$_=”"}’                                                                      

And if you like like what you see, add | sh

Personally I think Perl is just a bit more readable/writeable, without becoming to verbose (i dislike ruby for this, since it’s not that well suited for writing oneliners imho)
